Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> have few questions now. Please note that this is coming from a blockchain core newbie:
- in MMR the TXO commitments delays play some role in it's security and validity of the txout spends. How long is this delay in Verus' implementation?
- Need also a clarity and confirmation that if Mountain Merkle Ranges are compatible and implementable on the same blockchain which uses Merkle Roots? I feel like sounding a bit silly asking this question, but just asked.
- In that newsgroup post of Peter's it says the MMR TXO commitments can be verified solely by the Full nodes as well, if they wish to, as I understand from the concept of MMR the peaks can be used to generate the path to validate the UTXO/STXO/TXO spends/unspends. With that understanding the Miners doesn't has to do the amount of work for the validation part of these MMR. If I understood this part correct, can you please clear how this validation of peaks and TXO commitments are handled in Verus? If it is validated by the miners, is that implementation applied to the stagers as well?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> Basically the video that I am going to link you describes the proofs like this- imagine I have a giant boulder and I want to prove to you that it exists. One way of doing this is that I can bring you to the boulder which would require time and effort or I can ship the boulder to you which would also require time and effort but there is a third option, let's say I take a photograph of the boulder and bring that to you, it requires less work and less time but I can still prove to you that the boulder exist and describe it to you in detail

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> If you prune your MMR, you basically remove UTXOs that have been spent, so they no longer matter. But if you rescan the previous blocks in the chain, the pruned data s still available there. So if you want insight in the spent UTXOs you can walk back into the chain history, to ‚Äòunprune‚Äô you‚Äôre MMR

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> hmm... so does that mean I don't need to connect to the rest of the nodes to unpruned my full node?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> does that also means that MMR can be overlayed or applied along with the UTXO model? I feel confused that if MMR is totally different implementation of data structure for a blockchain or is extending the existing UTXO model?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Theoretically you should be able to retrieve that data from the chain you have in store. Since every block should match the block of the same height on every other node (otherwise you‚Äôve forked away) it‚Äôs useless to ask other nodes for this unpruned data, since they too have to look it up in their chain history.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> okay, that clears at least the pruning/unpruning part. üôÇ Thanks üëç

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Compare it to spending money.... you give somebody a 10 dollar note and receive back a 1 dollar note.... the 10 dollar note UTXO is gone and can be pruned and you got a new 1 dollar note UTXO on a new branch in the tree..... once that is 1 dollar note UTXO is spent, you can prune the entire branch back to the ‚Äòoldest‚Äô unspent UTXO...
those notes are no longer in your wallet, so not worth remembering.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> agree

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> Very important to note that we do NOT use MMRs at all like other coins. I can‚Äôt answer with details at the moment, but the discussion took a turn, and talk of UTXOs with MMR, etc don‚Äôt apply to Verus use at all. Same structure, different uses. Like I said, the closest use case is in the FlyClient paper. Nothing anyone else is doing really relates to Verus use of MMRs. It‚Äôs a tool with many possible uses.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> As far as efficiency, from a raw data structure perspective, we almost certainly have the most efficient MMR implementation there is. Finally, it is in the current release, but is not yet used until PBaaS.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> Depends on your goals... 
- A profit-miner will want to exchange ASAP to a coin that's valuable to him.
- An investor will accumulate as much as feasible to sell in future at a profit.
- A Coin supporter will get enough for staking to secure the network.
- A careful 'newbie' will get a small amount to see what he can do with it.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <grewalsatinder> Let me expand on the first point:
- 51% attack resistant even without dPoW, that means Verus is having 3 layers protection:
- Consensus algo 50%: Verushash v2 Proof of Work
- Consensus algo 50%: Verushash v2 Proof of Power/Proof of Stake
- Consensus algo makes it 51% attack being 50/50
- Komodo dPoW notarisation is 2nd' layer of 51% attack.
